text:
Here are some quick tips for using M2Studio. Need more tips? Check out the User Guide.

Naming variables

  • You can use letters and numbers to name variables, and the name must start with a letter. Since no space is allowed in variable names, you can connect multiple words using an underscore ("variable_name") or capitalize the first letter of each word ("VariableName").

Units

  • Frequently used standard units and abbreviations: "m" or "meter", "s" or "second" (see more below)
  • Use "$" for "dollar"
  • Use "/" for "per", e.g., "m/s", "$/lb"
  • Plural and singular are treated the same, e.g., "cat" and "cats" are the same.

Value

  • You can enter integers and decimals.
  • Ratios, fractions, and percentages are not supported yet. You must convert them to decimals first, e.g., 1:10, 1/10, or 10% should be converted to 0.1

Expression

  • Operators: + addition, - subtraction, * multiplication, / division, ^ exponentiation (e.g., "a^b" means "raise a to the power of b")
  • Use one or more ( ) to ensure the desired order of operation, ((a + b) * c - d) / e.

Converting computed units

  • If the computed unit is not in the form you want (e.g., in seconds when you want it in minutes), convert it using the "to [unit]" function in the expression. For example, for the variables "distance = 1 mile" and "speed = 4 miles/hour", the computed result of the expression "distance/speed" will be "900 s". To convert it to "min", add "to min" to the end of the expression: "distance/speed to min". This will give the result as "15 min."

Built-in standard units

You can use either the unit word (“meter”) or its common abbreviation (“m”).

  • Length: meter (m), inch (in), foot (ft), yard (yd), mile (mi);
  • Surface area: m2, sqin, sqft, sqyd, sqmi, sqrd;
  • Volume: m3, litre (L, liter), cc, cuin, cuft, cuyd, teaspoon, tablespoon;
  • Liquid volume: fluidounce (floz), cup, pint (pt), quart (qt), gallon (gal);
  • Angles: rad (radian), deg (degree);
  • Time: second (s, secs, seconds), minute (min, mins, minutes), hour (h, hr, hrs, hours), day (days), week (weeks), month (months), year (years), decade (decades), century (centuries), millennium (millennia);
  • Mass: gram(g), tonne, ton, ounce (oz), poundmass (lb, lbs);
  • Temperature: kelvin (K), celsius (degC), fahrenheit (degF).
  • Frequently used decimal prefixes for International System of Units can also be used: kilo, centi, milli (see more in User Guide).
